news.title: Michael Flatley to make bid for Irish presidency, court told
news.summary: Riverdance star Michael Flatley is to seek a nomination to become Ireland’s next president, a court has heard.

news.title: Weight tax for SUVs now on the table for Budget 2026 as strategy papers offer a glimpse at potential measures
news.summary: A tax on family SUVs is being considered among a number of options ahead of Budget 2026.

news.title: Timeline of Food Safety Authority listeria warnings: first alert was issued late last month
news.summary: Two Food Safety Authority (FSAI) prohibition orders were first issued due to potential ­concerns around listeria contamination in two Ballymaguire Foods ­products last week and at the end of June.

news.title: Heartbreak in Co Clare village as locals mourn mother and two teenage children who died in Fermanagh shooting
news.summary: The sun shone, but the mood was one of heartbreak in the Co Clare village of Barefield, 6km from Ennis.

news.title: Cian O’Neill, the outside man with the Midas touch after 20 years in hurling and football: can he do a Kerry repeat?
news.summary: Connection has always been the most important part of the coaching process for Cian O’Neill and it’s fair to say he has left his imprint all over the county scene through 20 unbroken seasons operating at the highest level.

news.title: Fire breaks out at Conor McGregor’s Black Forge pub
news.summary: Emergency services were at the scene of a fire at a Dublin pub owned by retired MMA fighter Conor McGregor.

news.title: Hunt under way as aggravated burglary suspect released from jail by mistake while co-accused brother fails to show for court
news.summary: Gardaí are searching for a 29-year-old man who was released from prison by mistake three weeks ago after being remanded in custody accused of involvement in an aggravated burglary.

news.title: Tanya Sweeney: We need to let people drink or not drink without judgment – so pub rounds need to go
news.summary: I can enjoy a couple of glasses of wine without wondering if I should crack open another bottle to keep the buzz going. I can flop down on the sofa on Friday night and realise that, no, I’m not gasping for that wind-down drink the way I once used to. And, in a genuine first for me, I went to a birthday party recently and had water all night. There was no grand design to stay sober. I wanted a sparkling water

news.title: Living in America: ‘People warned me about soaring inflation when I moved to Boston, but my grocery shop is cheaper than it was at home’
news.summary: Before I moved to America, I was warned everything was going to be expensive, especially with Donald Trump’s new tariffs in place.

news.title: ‘I abseiled 150 feet from the top of Croke Park for charity – I highly recommend it’
news.summary: I had witnessed Croke Park plenty of times, but never like this – 150 feet up, strapped in a harness, staring down from the roof and about to do a charity abseil for Focus Ireland.
